meanings.definition: To surpass in swearing or using profane language.
meanings.sent1: He always tries to outsware his friends when they play video games.
meanings.sent2: She tends to outsware when she gets frustrated with her computer.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to outsware after spending time with the sailors.
meanings.sent4: The comedian managed to outsware the audience with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent5: The angry driver began to outsware loudly at the traffic jam.

meanings.definition: To expose or reveal something that was previously hidden or secret.
meanings.sent1: The detective was able to outsware the criminal's true identity.
meanings.sent2: The journalist decided to outsware the corruption within the government.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick accidentally outsware how he performed the illusion.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise outsware the beauty of the landscape in all its glory.
meanings.sent5: The documentary outsware the harsh reality of life in the wilderness.
